icon.name: Icon
icon.hint: The icon to show in the HUD

hudColumn.name: HUD Column
hudColumn.hint: Which HUD column to place the button in

hudTopBottom.name: HUD Top/Bottom
hudTopBottom.hint: Where to place the button in the column

riderLock.name: Should riders be locked to mounts?
riderLock.hint: [No need anymore] If enabled, riders will be unable to move separately from their mount until dismounted. NOTE: with the new 'can Move Constrained' from Token Attacher you don't need to touch this anymore, but i leave if anyone find useful for set a initial position of the rider on the mount.

riderRotate.name: Should riders rotate with mounts?
riderRotate.hint: [No need anymore] If enabled, rider rotation will be updated to match mount rotation. NOTE: with the new 'can Move Constrained' from Token Attacher you don't need to touch this anymore, but i leave if anyone find useful for set a initial position of the rider on the mount.

riderX.name: Rider Horizontal Alignment
riderX.hint: [No need anymore] By default is center. NOTE: with the new 'can Move Constrained' from Token Attacher you don't need to touch this anymore, but i leave if anyone find useful for set a initial position of the rider on the mount.

riderY.name: Rider Vertical Alignment
riderY.hint: [No need anymore] By default is center. NOTE: with the new 'can Move Constrained' from Token Attacher you don't need to touch this anymore, but i leave if anyone find useful for set a initial position of the rider on the mount.

shouldChat.name: Send messages to chat
shouldChat.hint: Should chat messages about mounting/carrying and dismounting/dropping be sent to chat?

mountMsg.name: Mount Message Format
mountMsg.hint: How mounting chat messages should be formatted if enabled. (use {rider} and {mount} for name substitution)

dismountMsg.name: Dismount Message Format
dismountMsg.hint: How dismounting chat messages should be formatted if enabled. (use {rider} and {mount} for name substitution)

pipPosition.name: Rider Position
pipPosition.hint: [No need anymore] Set the position for the rider (by default is center). NOTE: with the new 'can Move Constrained' from Token Attacher you don't need to touch this anymore, but i leave if anyone find useful for set a initial position of the rider on the mount.

enableActiveEffect.name: Enable active token mount up management
enableActiveEffect.hint: Every time you mount up or dismount on the mount token and/or rider token some active effect can be added or removed based on the changes configuration on both rider and mount

enableAutoUpdateElevation.name: Enable auto update elevation
enableAutoUpdateElevation.hint: If enabled thi setting will make sure to always sync the riders elevation with the mount elevation

enableCanMoveConstrained.name: Enable 'can move constrained'
enableCanMoveConstrained.hint: Enable the new 'Can Move Constrained' feature from Token Attacher

enableDragAndDropMountUp.name: Enable drag and drop token for mountup
enableDragAndDropMountUp.hint: If Enabled when dragging and dropped a token it will try to mount the below token if present and if you have permissions on that token

hudDisableForMount.name: Disable the HUD integration for the 'Mount' action
hudDisableForMount.hint: Make sense only with 'Enable drag and drop token for mountup' enabled. It will hide the hud integration of the hud module for mountup, but it will appear for the dismount.

showDialogOnDropMountUp.name: Enable show dialog on drop Mount Up
showDialogOnDropMountUp.hint: Make sense only with 'Enable drag and drop token for mountup' enabled. If enabled when you drop a token (rider) on a token (mount) if will pop out a dialog for confirmation

debug.name: Enable debugging
debug.hint: Prints debug messages to the console

dialogCleanUp.title: Clean up 'Mount Up' macro
dialogCleanUp.message: This action will run a fixing macro on the curren token for clean up any information of 'Mount Up' from this token and start everything from scratch, THIS IS USEFUL FOR THE USE CASES WHERE THE FLAGS REMAIN STUCKED, are you sure about this ?

mountup.confirmationDialogDropMountUpMessage: Did you want the '{rider}' to mount up '{mount}' ?
